a45afe8b1ffa62c92bb1c910981a19060ec2a1a5.title: Unsafe defaults in remark-html
a45afe8b1ffa62c92bb1c910981a19060ec2a1a5.description: The documentation of remark-html has mentioned that it was safe by default. In practise the default was never safe and had to be opted into. This means arbitrary HTML can be passed through leading to potential XSS attacks.

9aa271d7bce8186382e4a230b5df8ac82fb08f48.title: Command Injection in lodash
9aa271d7bce8186382e4a230b5df8ac82fb08f48.description: lodash versions prior to 4.17.21 are vulnerable to Command Injection via the template function.

8ae473758175dab908362f5cb4aef6e8694434b8.title: Prototype Pollution in lodash
8ae473758175dab908362f5cb4aef6e8694434b8.description: Versions of lodash prior to 4.17.19 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. The function zipObjectDeep allows a malicious user to modify the prototype of Object if the property identifiers are user-supplied.

46418c48f5767cd3b849fdd2f63fa3a98f45ccce.title: Remote Memory Exposure in request
46418c48f5767cd3b849fdd2f63fa3a98f45ccce.description: Affected versions of request will disclose local system memory to remote systems in certain circumstances. When a multipart request is made, and the type of body is number, then a buffer of that size will be allocated and sent to the remote server as the body.

3c13275d615d6f0d5216e1bd9817f4cbaa2239a3.title: Arbitrary Code Execution in underscore
3c13275d615d6f0d5216e1bd9817f4cbaa2239a3.description: The package underscore from 1.13.0-0 and before 1.13.0-2, from 1.3.2 and before 1.12.1 are vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution via the template function, particularly when a variable property is passed as an argument as it is not sanitized.

f14d017f086e21faaee5424f2c15605f4221caa7.title: Server-Side Request Forgery in Axios
f14d017f086e21faaee5424f2c15605f4221caa7.description: Axios NPM package 0.21.0 contains a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerability where an attacker is able to bypass a proxy by providing a URL that responds with a redirect to a restricted host or IP address.

565c6222f72f312aab894ed49d535f154315b241.title: Incorrect Comparison in axios
565c6222f72f312aab894ed49d535f154315b241.description: axios is vulnerable to Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity

01db520831d20f27f20b344626a0c11e66bd777a.title: Prototype Pollution in minimist
01db520831d20f27f20b344626a0c11e66bd777a.description: Affected versions of minimist are vulnerable to prototype pollution. Arguments are not properly sanitized, allowing an attacker to modify the prototype of Object, causing the addition or modification of an existing property that will exist on all objects.

edaeadaba118db7c4c44990fe30d9383f6d09c5b.title: Improper Privilege Management in shelljs
edaeadaba118db7c4c44990fe30d9383f6d09c5b.description: shelljs is vulnerable to Improper Privilege Management

86d10d47dfbc6cb3005251f11979cfa55b0ccfae.title: Denial of Service in js-yaml
86d10d47dfbc6cb3005251f11979cfa55b0ccfae.description: Versions of js-yaml prior to 3.13.0 are vulnerable to Denial of Service. By parsing a carefully-crafted YAML file, the node process stalls and may exhaust system resources leading to a Denial of Service.

f96079bef7cef64e2dce919655d1bb4e536bfb6f.title: Code Injection in js-yaml
f96079bef7cef64e2dce919655d1bb4e536bfb6f.description: Versions of js-yaml prior to 3.13.1 are vulnerable to Code Injection. The load() function may execute arbitrary code injected through a malicious YAML file. Objects that have toString as key, JavaScript code as value and are used as explicit mapping keys allow attackers to execute the supplied code through the load() function. The safeLoad() function is unaffected.

2c2526d3e1bd393371fe201991c885ab60ceaeec.title: Prototype Pollution in handlebars
2c2526d3e1bd393371fe201991c885ab60ceaeec.description: The package handlebars before 4.7.7 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution when selecting certain compiling options to compile templates coming from an untrusted source.

de4052454aa3f0d9ec5d8d2b561d931096e2e710.title: Arbitrary Code Execution in Handlebars
de4052454aa3f0d9ec5d8d2b561d931096e2e710.description: Handlebars before 3.0.8 and 4.x before 4.5.3 is vulnerable to Arbitrary Code Execution. The lookup helper fails to properly validate templates, allowing attackers to submit templates that execute arbitrary JavaScript.

182c7374f92a5f3c32cc81c79b18cc7c3c6393c9.title: Remote code execution in handlebars when compiling templates
182c7374f92a5f3c32cc81c79b18cc7c3c6393c9.description: The package handlebars before 4.7.7 are vulnerable to Remote Code Execution (RCE) when selecting certain compiling options to compile templates coming from an untrusted source.

2e57f9256e8ba527fda341d9c99b4219993c9aa6.title: Prototype Pollution in handlebars
2e57f9256e8ba527fda341d9c99b4219993c9aa6.description: Versions of handlebars prior to 3.0.8 or 4.3.0 are vulnerable to Prototype Pollution leading to Remote Code Execution. Templates may alter an Objects' __proto__ and __defineGetter__ properties, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code through crafted payloads.

9cc594509d72a233cd30268fdcd844b0048c457f.title: Insecure defaults due to CORS misconfiguration in socket.io
9cc594509d72a233cd30268fdcd844b0048c457f.description: The package socket.io before 2.4.0 are vulnerable to Insecure Defaults due to CORS Misconfiguration. All domains are whitelisted by default.

679f4709114dd04374223cd778a3495643f89586.title: Insecure randomness in socket.io
679f4709114dd04374223cd778a3495643f89586.description: Affected versions of socket.io depend on Math.random() to create socket IDs, and therefore the IDs are predictable. With enough information on prior IDs, an attacker may be able to guess the socket ID and gain access to socket.io servers without authorization.

d0940ae325b0bda417fc8d828736c8f379f132eb.title: ReDoS in Sec-Websocket-Protocol header
d0940ae325b0bda417fc8d828736c8f379f132eb.description: A specially crafted value of the Sec-Websocket-Protocol header can be used to significantly slow down a ws server.

e80ec02956b4c0182adccbdcd5030576137d8e82.title: Denial of Service in ws
e80ec02956b4c0182adccbdcd5030576137d8e82.description: Affected versions of ws can crash when a specially crafted Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header containing Object.prototype property names as extension or parameter names is sent.

07ab4e39140ba01f4e7591e6307182fbedc945cb.title: High severity vulnerability that affects ejs
07ab4e39140ba01f4e7591e6307182fbedc945cb.description: nodejs ejs version older than 2.5.5 is vulnerable to a denial-of-service due to weak input validation in the ejs.renderFile()

47894fe9a88f8ade82d18ab9885b294ca926a353.title: Improper Input Validation in Automattic Mongoose
47894fe9a88f8ade82d18ab9885b294ca926a353.description: Automattic Mongoose through 5.7.4 allows attackers to bypass access control (in some applications) because any query object with a _bsontype attribute is ignored. For example, adding "_bsontype":"a" can sometimes interfere with a query filter.

95f500760771ea7b2d24585f7e6c8b0282685fce.title: Potential exponential regex in monitor mode
95f500760771ea7b2d24585f7e6c8b0282685fce.description: When a client is in monitoring mode, the regex begin used to detected monitor messages could cause exponential backtracking on some strings. This issue could lead to a denial of service.

49511b3e86c4824b47e8cb1b3ebca769112d6c7c.title: Vulnerable jQuery version 3.4.1
49511b3e86c4824b47e8cb1b3ebca769112d6c7c.description: All jQuery version below 3.5.0 suffer from multiple vulnerabilities
